notes.head: Note
notes.body: fol. iii r: nine words in four columns; fol. iii v: two word pairs. All in the Tremulous Hand.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: One word pair in the Tremulous Hand (pencil)

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (vi r/1 -vi r/1) : Robertus rex francorum victime pascali..

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Explicit (Latin): (vi r/13-vi r/14) : Robertus eboracensis: exultemus i hac die festiva; Quidam canonicus toruacensis.ʹ historiam de trinitate.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: A list of writers of hymns, and hymns ascribed to them. Reproduced in Crawford 1928, p. 5.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (vi r/15) : Ic ileue on enne god fæder almihti

notes.head: Note
notes.body: In top margin, s. xiii, 'recti diligunt te suete lefdi seinte marie'; immediately below it, in the Tremulous Hand, a string of Latin synonyms.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body:
Incipit (Latin): Benedicamus uos regnanti desuper
gratias
domino || Deo per secula pueri reddite gratias.

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: On first page after composition of manuscript [not main hand]

notes.head: Note
notes.body: This page is blank apart from two neumed lines, and "writ ðus" above this.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (1v/1-marginal) Canon Affricanus (also Canon Affricanus, cut away on left: marginal, later).

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (1v/1) : Clericus non debet armis uti

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): Si quis clericus homicidium fecerit

notes.head: Note
notes.body: See also Cross and Hamer 1999, pp. 108 (no. 102) and 171 (no. 167).

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): CAPITULA CONCILII APUD WINCEASTRAM CELEBRATI

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (2v/11) : Quod nulli liceat duobus episcopatibus praesidere.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Explicit (Latin): (3r/10) Quod calici non sint cerei

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The bowls of P, Q, S are coloured in green.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (4r/11) Anno ab incarnatione domini millesimo. lxx.vi.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Explicit (Latin): (4v/17-18x) Supplan|tationes uero ęcclesiarum omnibus modis inter dicimus. FINIT.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Numbered in five sections: I-XLIII (fols 93-69v); I-XV (fols 69v-74r); I-XXX (fols 74r-80v); I-XVI (fols 80v-84v); I-XXX (fols 84v-110v). The last four sections are referred to as Books 1-4; the first three books correspond to the first three books of the 'Penitential of Pseudo-Egbert', while the fourth is miscellaneous (fol. 8v blank). Fol. 5 has wormholes (just); fol. 6 does not. Fol. 7v: scribe stops using two columns and just writes contents out in one column. Fol. 8r TOC stops, l. 13. Fol. 8v is blank.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (9r/2-4) IN NOMINI DOMINI | An is ece cyning ƿealdend and ƿyrhta ealra gesceafta.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (9r/6-7) Him symble sy lof and ƿuldor and ece ƿyrðmynt á to ƿorulde. Amen.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (9r/9-12) CHRISTENUM CYNINGE gebyreð on cristenre þeode þæt he sy ealsƿa hit riht is folces frófer and rihtƿis hyrde ofer cristene heorde.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (10r/20-22) Ac se byð gesælig þe godcunde lare oftost gehyreð and geornlicast healdeþ.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand, and some word divisions

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (10r/23) EAHTA SǷERAS SYNDON || þe rihtlicne cynedom trumlice upƿegað

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (10v/14-16) ˥ seofoðe, þæt he be freondan and be fremdan fadige gelice on rihtlican dome.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (10v/17-19) ÆLC RIHT CYNESTOL STENT | on þrym stapelum þe fullice ariht stent | on þrym stapelum · þe fullice a riht stent | áris.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (11r/17-19) Ac dó man sƿa hit þearf is alecge man únriht and rære up Godes riht þæt mæg to þearfe for Gode and for ƿorulde. Amen.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (11r/21-12r/2) CYNINGAN AND BISCEOPAN. | eorlan ˥ heretogan gerefan and deman | larƿitan and lahƿitan gedafenað mid rihte || for Gode and for ƿorulde | þæt hi ánræde ƿeorðan and Godes riht lufian.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (12r/21-12v/2) Ic ƿat sƿyðe georne me sylfne forƿorhtne | ƿordes and dæde ealles to sƿyðe ne dear || þeah for forsƿygian mid ealle | Godes ege fela þara þinga þe dereð þisse þeode.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (12v/4-7) BISCEOPAS SCULAN BOCVM | ˥ gebedum fyligean ˥ dæges ˥ nihtes oft ˥ gelome clypian to Criste ˥ for eall cristen | folc þingian georne.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (13v/3-6) Nu lære ƿe eac georne | manna gehƿylcne þæt he Godes larum ˥ his | lagum fylgie þonne geearnað he him ece | myrhðe.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (13v/7-9) BISCEOPE GEBYREÐ ÆLC | rihting ge on godcundan þingan ge on | ƿoruldcundan.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (15r/1-3) Þy ƿe agan þearfe þæt ƿe ðam beorgan þe us | scylan hyran þonne gebide ƿe þe mare | gebeorh æt Godes agenum dome.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (15r/4-7) BISCEOPES DÆGǷEORC ÐÆT | bið mid rihte his gebedu ærest ˥ ðonne | his boc ƿeorc · ˥ ræding oððon rihting lar oððon leornung

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (15r/14-16) ˥ eac him gerisð ƿel þæt he on gemote | oft ˥ gelome godcunde lare dæle þam | folce þe he þonne mid sy.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand, and one erasure (fol. 15r)

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (15r/17-20) A GERIST. BISCEOPUM. ǷISDOM | ˥ ƿærscype ˥ þæt þa habban ƿeorðlice | ƿisan þa þa heom fylian ˥ þæt hy sundor|cræfta sumne eac cunnen.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (15v/1-3) Ac ƿisdom ˥ ƿærscipe gedafeniað heora hade ˥ gedrihþa gerisaþ þam ðe heom fyliað.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (15v/5) Deus in adiutorium meum intende. ter.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Bisceopum gebyreð þæt hi mid geþylde geþo|lian þæt hi sylfe begetan ne magan oð þæt | hit þa, cyncge gecyþed ƿeorðe ˥ bete he | syððan Godes abylhþe þær bisceop | ne mæge gif he Godes ƿillan rihte ƿylle | ƿyrcean ˥ his agene cynescype rihtlice | aræran.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (17r/11-14) EORLAS AND HERETOGAN. | ˥ ðas ƿoruld deman. and eac sƿa gere|fan agan nydþearfe þaet hi riht lufian | for Gode ˥ for ƿorulde.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (17v/9-13) Ac dó freonda | gehyƿylc eallsƿa hit þearf is ƿarnige hine | georne ˥ beorge him sylfum þæt he God ne á|belge ealles to sƿyðe ac cƿeme his drihtne | mid rihtlicre dæde.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand, erasure in margin on fol. 17v

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (17v/14-16) RIHT IS ÐÆT GEREFAN GE|eornlice tylian ˥ symle heora hla|fordan strynan mid rihte.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (18r/14-17) ˥ ƿa þæs gestreones þam þe his mæst hafaþ | on unriht gestryned butan he gesƿice | ˥ ðe deoppor gebete for Gode ˥ for ƿor|ulde.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand, and erasure in word division on fol. 18r

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (18r/18-21) RIHT IS ÞÆT ABBODAS ˥ HVRV | abbadissan fæste on mynstrum sing|allice ƿunian ˥ georne heora heorda | symle beguman ˥ áá heom ƿel bysenian | ˥ rihtlice bodian

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (14v/4-7) RIHT IS ÞÆT MUNECAS BEON | dæges ˥ nihtes inƿeardre heortan | á to Gode þencan ˥ geornlice clypian ˥ mid | eallum eadmedum regollice libban.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (19r/19-22) Ac ƿe agan néode þæt ƿe hit gebetan sƿa ƿe | geornost magan ˥ ƿeorðan anmode | to gemænelicre þearfe for Gode and for | ƿorulde.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (19v/1-5) ARIHT IS ÞÆT MYNECENA | mynsterlice macian efne sƿa ƿe cƿædon æror be munecan ˥ ne toƿettan ƿoruldmannum ne ænige sundorcyððe to heom habban ealles to sƿyðe

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (19v/5-7) ac á regolice libban ˥ hi symle asyndrian fram ƿoruldbysegan sƿa hi geornost magan.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (19v/7-8) xiiii BE PREOSTAN | ˥ BE NUNNAN.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (19v/9-13) RIHT IS ÐÆT PREOSTAS | ˥ efen ƿel nunnan regollice libban ˥ clænnysse healdan be þam þe hi ƿillan on mynstran geƿunian oððon for ƿorulde ƿeorðscypes ƿealdan.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand. Fol. 19r/23 is blank - there is a tear in the parchment.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (19v/14-15) RIHT IS ÐÆT ǷYDEǷAN. AN|nan bysenan geornlice fylian.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (9v/22-3) Sƿa sceall gód | ƿydeƿe hyran hyre drihtne.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (20r/2-5) LEOFAN MEN IC BIDDE. | geyrað hƿæt ic ƿylle secgan þurh godes | gyfe us eallum to þearfe gecnaƿe se þe | cunne.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (20v/11-12) And gyf he elles | do gebete hit georne.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (20v/13-16) SACERDAS SCULAN ON HEORA | scrift scirum ƿislice ˥ ƿærlice lædan | ˥ læran þa godcundan heorda þe hi healdan | sculan.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (23r/22-23v/3) Nis se man on life þe areccan mæge | ealle þa yrmða þe se gebidan sceall se ðe || on þa ƿitu ealles behreoseð ˥ hit is ealles | þe ƿyrse þe his ænig ende ne cymð næfre | to ƿorulde.

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Nero A. i; Tiberius A. iii; CCCC 201

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (23v/4-7) LA LEOF VNDERSTANDAÐ | eoƿ sylfe ˥ lufiað ˥ ƿeorðiað God ælmih|tigne ofer ealle oðre þinc ˥ healdað his | beboda georne.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (24r/18-21) Be mannes geƿrihtum hit man mot secan | æfter canondóme ˥ eac medemian be mihtum | ˥ be mæþe ˥ be þam þe man ongit his heortan | hreoƿsunge ˥ his sylfes geornfulnesse.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Fols 23v/14-24r/21 appear as fols 67r/7-67v/17 below. Glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (25r/1-4) TÆCAÐ CRISTENUM MANNUM | georne ˥ gelome rihtne geleafan ˥ þæt hi | cunnon heora cristendome ˥ heora | fulluhtes gescead ƿitan.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (25v/3-6) God ælmihtig helpe ure ˥ sancta | Maria ˥ gefultumie us eallum þæt ƿe ægðer | ge us sylfe ge þa þe ƿe ƿisian sceolan sƿa | geƿisian motan sƿa sƿa ure ealra þearf sy.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (25v/7) xx ITEM DE SINODALIA DECRETA.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (25v/8-10) RIHT IS ÞÆT PREOSTAS BEON | geornlice gode þeoƿiende ˥ ðeniende | ˥ for eall cristen folc ðingiende

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (31v/8-9) Þonne geleanað him þæt | god ælmihtig sƿa him leofost bið. Amen.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (31v/11-13) RIHT IS ÐÆT GEHADODE MEN | læƿede ƿisian hu hi heora æƿe rihtlicost | sculon healdan.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (32r/11-13) Nagon læƿede men | freolstídum ne fæstentídum þurh hæmed|ðing ƿifes gemanan þe ma þe heahhades men | þæt ðing agan ænigum timan.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (32r/15-18) GEHADEDVM MANNVM | gebyreð ælc clænnes forðam þe hi | sculon eallum oðrum mannum ælce un|clænnesse forbeodan.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (34r/1-3) God eoƿ getrymme to eoƿre agenre þearfe ˥ us ealle gehealde sƿa his ƿylla sy. Amen.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (34r/5-9) LEOFAN MEN IN LIBRO VISI|onum is aƿriten hu þa mæssepreostas | ˥ ða diaconas þe misleofedan her on ƿorulde | ƿæron on ƿælhreoƿlice geseƿene | sƿa sƿa se encgel gesƿutelode on ðære gesihðe.|

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (35v/12-17) ˥ se þe | heahhád underfo gyf he sy mæssepreost | þonne gemæssige he for his biscop XXX | mæssan ˥ diacon gesinge XXX psaltera | ˥ áá heora lifdagas gebiddon þærto|eacan for hine georne.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand. Also, glosses from the scribe with the very long ascenders and descenders.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (35v/19-21) HEAHHADAS SYNDON | to healdenne. mid sƿiðe miclum ƿis|dome ˥ mid ealre clænnesse.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (42r/17-18) God us gefylste þæt ƿe moton ealle sƿa don. | Amen.

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: CCCC 190; CCCC 201. Second half also in Napier XLVI

notes.head: Note
notes.body: There is a major heading on fol. 40r/15 [beg. NE BEO NAN MAN OÐRES but this seems to be a division in one text rather than two since there is no new rubric. Glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand, who has also noted each of the orders in the margins (as well as other glossing). fol. 39: small hole in parchment.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (42r/18) xxu De officiis diurnalium noctur|nalium horarum

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (42r/20-23) GODCUND ÞEOǷDOM IS GE|sett on cyriclicum þenungum æfter | canoneclican geƿunan to nýdrihte eallum | gehadedum mannum.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (55v/20) God ús gefultumige. to ure ðearfe sƿa his ƿylla sy. amen.

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: CCCC 201 contains the prose parts of this exposition with minor variations, and a poem (Gloria) which has been used in the composition of this text. The metrical psalm-verses are almost identical to those in the Paris Psalter.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Glosses throughout by the Tremulous Hand. Fol. 43r (half-sheet) has two small holes in the bottom righthand corner, and on fol. 51v note by Coleman.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: ÆALDLICE LAH | geƿritu. | ˥ eac godƿpellice bebodu us lærað ˥ myngiað þæt ƿe eallum mode || ˥ eallum mægene ærest God lufian ˥ ƿurðian ˥ syðþan ure nextan lufian ˥ healdan sƿa sƿa us sylfe.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: þonne geearnað hy lof æt mannum ˥ æt Gode sylfum ece edlean.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: RIHT IS ÐÆT CRISTENE MEN | cristendom georne healdan mid rihte ˥ Cristes cyrican æghƿær geornlice ƿeorþian ˥ ƿerian.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: ˥ utan ænne cynehlaford holdlice healdan ˥ freonda gehƿylc oðerne healde mid rihtan getryƿðan.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (59r/9) xxxui Be eallum christenum mannum.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: RIHT IS ÐÆT EALLE CRISTE|ne men heora cristendom rihtlice | healdan ˥ ðam life libban þe heom to gebyrað æfter Godes rihte ˥ æfter ƿoruldgerysenum

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: ˥ beorgan us georne ƿið þone ƿeallendan bryne helleƿites ˥ geearnian us ða mærða ˥ myrhða ðe God hæfð gegearƿod þam ðe his ƿillan on ƿorulde geƿyrcað. Amen.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Ðis sýnd þa Godes ƿord þe god sýlf gedihte | ˥ moýse befæste ˥ eal hit mæg to býsne | æghƿýlcere ðeode gýme se ðe ƿille god | XXXVIII us gehealde · amen ·

notes.head: Note
notes.body: major heading at fol. 60r/17L EALA LEOFAN MEN BE þylcan bysenan ƿe us magon ƿar|nian.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Her is scrift ˥ an|detnes ægðer tƿegra ge gehadodra. gelæ|ƿedra. þæra þe þæs andgites habbað. ˥ ðæs | ledenes deopnesse ne cunnon.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: ÞONNE MAN TO HIS SCRIFTE | gangeð · þonne sceall he mid sƿýðe mý|celum godes ege ˥ eadmodnesse beforan | christum hine aþenian · and hine biddan ƿépen|dre stefne ·

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: LEOFA MAN ÐE IS MYCEL | þearf þ æt ðu þas drihtenlican tíde georne geþence.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (64r/17) xxxuiiii Be ðæs halgan sun|nandæges gebede.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: LEOFAN MENN | understandað georne eallsƿa eoƿ mycel | ðearf is.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (65v/14) xl Be þæs mæssepreostas ge|sceadƿisnysse.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: ÞÆT SCEALL GE|þencan se ðe byð manna saƿla lǽce.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: ON ǷISUM SCRIFTE BYÞ | sƿyðe forð gelang.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: SE LÆCA ÐE SCEL | sare ƿunda ƿel gehælan.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (67v/17) xliii Be | þeódores gesetnysse hu man sceall fæs|ten alýsan.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: ÐEODORVS SE HALGA. | ˥ se goda biscop gesetta þas rædinge.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (69v/8) i INCIPIT | LIBER primus. cum capitolis atque cum suis sentialis, Þis is ærest se forma capitul..

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: HIT GEBYRAÐ ÞÆT SE SA|cerd smeage

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Chapters are numbered i-xu (Book 1); i-xxx (Book 2); i-xui (Book 3); i (Book 4)

bib.page:
1933, vols 1-4.11, pp.
                           1-53 (up to fol. 86v/10); pp. 6-70 (the rest)

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (87r/11) ii Iu|dicium de peccatis multis.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Seo æreste forlætnes is fyrena fulƿiht.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: In Spindler's edition the order of the sections differs.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: GYF HYǷLC MAN ǷIFIGE ON HIS | nextan magan

notes.head: Note
notes.body: It also occurs on fol. 77v as Book 2, chap. 17

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (101r/15-18) Me scripsit wulfgeatus scriptor | wigornensis. ora obsecrio pro ipsius neuis | cosmi satorem. Amen. Et qui me scripsit | semper sit felix. AMEN.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Possibly copied from exemplar rather than original to the main scribe, since it follows directly from the previous item.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): Ælfricus humilis frater uenerabili episcopo | wulfsino salutem indigno.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: After this item there are possibly some pages missing. This marks a change of plan in the production of the manucript, which seems originally to have been intended with Hatton 113 and Hatton 114 as one large volume.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (111r/1) DE SEUNDA [sic] EPISTOLA QUANDO DIUIDIS | CRISMA |

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Gefultumige us se hælend to his halgum bebodum se þe leofad mid his leofan fæder ˥ ðam halgan gaste on anre godcundnysse hi þrý án God, æfre rixiende. Amen.

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: CCCC 190; Bodley 343; Vespasian D. xiv; Tiberius A. iii

notes.head: Note
notes.body: This is a homily adapted from Ælfric's Letter to Wulfgeat: it does not contain the first 89 lines in Assman's edition.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): Cum autem uenerit paraclitus quem | ego mittam uobis a patre. Et reliqua. | Se hæland her on life.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Leofan men understandað sƿyðe georne | þæt ge rihtlice ˥ ƿærlice

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Ðíses dæges þéning ˥ þissere tide mærð | sprecað ymbe godes tocyme.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Se godspellere lucas aƿrát on ðisum dægðerlican godspelle.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Nu ƿe habbað eoƿ gesæd | anfealdlice

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: The preface has been adapted as a homily: the same adaptation is found in Hatton 115.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: On fol. 155v, with musical notes: Iste homo ab atholescentia sua partim meruit in firmos curare dedit illi dominus claritatem magnam cecos illuminare et demones effugare.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): IN ASSUMPTIONE SANCTĘ Marie UIRGINIS.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): INTRAUIT IESUS IN QUODDAM CASTELLUM. RELIQUA. | Se hælend becom into sumere eaðlican byrig.

handDesc.summary: The bulk of the manuscript (fols 5-137) is written by one hand (Ker's Hand 1,

characters.note: same occasional high a
The shape of the second element of æ is influenced by the letter which succeeds it.
e is round-backed or horned depending on its place in the word and the following letter.
Wide tail on g.
s is slightly wedgier.
The descender of þ is notched.
Most ascenders except that of þ are clubbed, but some ascenders have wedged clubs and some are wedged; for example, on h and b, in English and Latin.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 1v-2v. This is very like the main hand; in fact, since the first folios are in Latin and much of Hand 1 is written in Old English, the two are not always directly comparable. Where Hand 1 writes in Latin there are similar features: some mixing of clubs and wedges; slant on Caroline
hands.summary: Some letters are distinct enough to suggest that these are two separate hands:

characters.note: more of a wedge on long s has a long descender in this hand.
x has a long descender in this hand.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 148v/10-22; 150r; 150v/16-151r; 152r-3v; 154r/17-154v/12. This hand is angular and upright, the letters are quite narrow, it is possibly the hand of

characters.note: The top of e in æ is very high.
d has a very short and tiny ascender.
g has an open bowl.
h has very tiny feet.
Long s is sometimes almost flat-topped.
The orum abbreviation slants downwards.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 3-4. This is quite a rounded Caroline script, wedges and clubs are not mixed (unlike in other hands in this manuscript).

characters.note: The orum abbreviation is straight.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 4r-v. This hand has long loopy descenders and wedges.

characters.note: Occasionally a big loopy Caroline a.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 138r-48v. This is quite like Hand 2, and just possibly could be the same as it, except that this hand seems less practised. This hand is rounder than Hand 1 and sometimes leans to the right slightly.

characters.note: ð tends to flick to the right.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 149r-v; 150v/1-15; 151v. This hand has wedges on the feet of minims. ˥ is almost at right-angles. The descenders don't usually have wedges on their feet. On fol 150v/1-15 possibly a thinner pen.

characters.note: y: curves to the left noticeably.
g: has a closed bowl.
Long s: very high and has quite a long descender, too. Very wedgy. This is similar to Hands 1 and 2, but quite thick.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 154r/1-16. Uneven hand. The letters are not always firmly on the ruled line.

characters.note: Ascender on d very short long.
Has a high e, slightly left-leaning.
a few.
Odd ð where the scribe has drawn o and then added an ascender.
Closed bowl on g.
Long descenders.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 154v-157. This scribe is not good at writing on the lines. This is a left-leaning, flowing script.

characters.note: a: round.
æ: round.
Open g.
High long s sometimes with descender drooping below the line.
˥ is high.
The top of ð curls round to the right. The bottoms of the descenders flick to the left
y long and left-flicking
Chunky feet on minims.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 157-60. This hand is quite square and wedgy.

characters.note: d the ascender is short.
y is long and flicks to the left
The bowl of g is open.

hands.name: glosses and alterations
hands.description: There are several layers of glosses by the

binding: Bound, s. xviii, in blind-tooled brown leather (Ure 1957, p. 3)

history.acquisition: It was amonst the manuscripts of Francis Junius, and acquired by the Bodleian Library in 1678.

admin: Manuscript described by Helen Foxhall Forbes with the assistance of Hollie Morgan (September 2010).
